select.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc
select.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a group of students selected at random
He had hopes of being selected for the national team.
York was selected as the site for the research centre.
They selected the winner from six finalists.
Simon’s been selected to go to the conference.
select.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, people usually say choose rather than select:
They chose the winner from six finalists.
select.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
select.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The party was small and select.
Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few.
select.translation[1].definitions[1].def: only lived in, visited, or used by a small number of rich people
select.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to choose something from a group of things, after thinking carefully about which is the best, most useful, most profitable etc
select.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The board hasn’t yet set a timetable for selecting a chief executive.
Investors shouldn’t select a stock fund just because it has low annual costs.
select.translation[2].definitions[1].def: if you select words or pictures on a computer screen, you use the MOUSE to make them change colour, before moving, cutting, or saving them
select.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: To copy a sentence, first select it and then press Control+C.
select.translation[3].definitions[0].def: used, visited, or bought only by a small group of people
select.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Haute couture designers create superexpensive clothes that are sold to a select few customers worldwide.
This flat is situated on a small select development.
